009
010package imagingbook.pub.regions.segment;
011
012import static imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D.N4;
013
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.Collections;
017import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
018import java.util.List;
019import java.util.Map;
020
021import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
022import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
023import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
024import imagingbook.pub.regions.BinaryRegion;
025
026/**
027 * Performs region segmentation on a given binary image.
028 * This class is abstract, since the implementation depends
029 * on the concrete region segmentation algorithm being used.
030 * Concrete implementations (subclasses of this class) are 
031 * {@link BreadthFirstSegmentation},
032 * {@link DepthFirstSegmentation},
033 * {@link RecursiveSegmentation},
034 * {@link SequentialSegmentation},
035 * {@link RegionContourSegmentation}.
036 * 
037 * Practically all work is done by the constructor(s).
038 * If the segmentation has failed for some reason
039 * {@link #getRegions()} returns {@code null}.
040 * 
041 * @version 2021/12/22
042 */
043public abstract class BinaryRegionSegmentation {
044        
045        public static final NeighborhoodType2D DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD = N4;
046        
047        public static final int BACKGROUND = 0;
048        public static final int FOREGROUND = 1;
049        
050        protected ImageProcessor ip = null;
051        protected final int width;
052        protected final int height;     
053        protected final NeighborhoodType2D NT;
054        
055        protected final int[][] labelArray;
056        // label values in labelArray can be:
057        //  0 ... unlabeled
058        // -1 ... previously visited background pixel
059        // >0 ... valid label
060        
061        private final Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> regions;
062        private final boolean isSegmented;
063        
064        private final int minLabel = 2;
065        private int currentLabel = -1;  // the maximum label assigned sofar
066        private int maxLabel = -1;              // the maximum label assigned total
067        
068        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
069        
070        protected BinaryRegionSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType2D nh) {
071                this.ip = ip;
072                this.NT = nh;
073                this.width  = ip.getWidth();
074                this.height = ip.getHeight();
075                this.labelArray = makeLabelArray();
076                this.isSegmented = applySegmentation();
077                this.regions = (isSegmented) ? collectRegions() : null;
078                this.ip = null; // release image
079        }
080        
081        protected int[][] makeLabelArray() {
082                int[][] lA = new int[width][height];    // label array
083                // set all pixels to either FOREGROUND or BACKGROUND (by thresholding)
084                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
085                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
086                                lA[u][v] = (ip.getPixel(u, v) > 0) ? FOREGROUND : BACKGROUND;
087                        }
088                }
089                return lA;
090        }
091        
092        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
093        
094        /**
095         * This method must be implemented by any concrete sub-class.
096         * @return true if successful.
097         */
098        protected abstract boolean applySegmentation();
099        
100        public int getWidth() {
101                return this.width;
102        }
103        
104        public int getHeight() {
105                return this.height;
106        }
107        
108        public int getMinLabel() {
109                return minLabel;
110        }
111        
112        public int getMaxLabel() {
113                return maxLabel;
114        }
115        
116        /**
117         * Returns an unsorted list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
118         * The returned list is empty if no regions were detected.
119         * See also {@link #getRegions(boolean)}.
120         * @return the list of detected regions or {@code null} if the segmentation has failed.
121         */
122        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions() {
123                return getRegions(false);       // unsorted
124//              return new ArrayList<>(regions.values());
125        }
126        
127        /**
128         * Returns a (optionally sorted) list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
129         * The returned list is empty if no regions were detected.
130         * @param sort set {@code true} to sort regions by size (largest regions first).
131         * @return the list of detected regions or {@code null} if the segmentation has failed.
132         */
133        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions(boolean sort) {
134                if (regions == null) {
135                        throw new RuntimeException("regions is null, this should not happen");
136                }
137
138                BinaryRegion[] ra = regions.values().toArray(new BinaryRegion[0]);
139                if (sort) {
140                        Arrays.sort(ra);
141                }
142                return Arrays.asList(ra);
143        }
144        
145        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
146        
147        /**
148         * Creates a (map) container of {@link BinaryRegion} objects,
149         * collects the region pixels from the label image
150         * and calls {@link SegmentationBackedRegion#update()} to compute
151         * the statistics for each region.
152         * Region label numbers serve as map keys.
153         * @return a map of {@link BinaryRegion} instances.
154         */
155        protected Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> collectRegions() {
156                SegmentationBackedRegion[] regionArray = new SegmentationBackedRegion[maxLabel + 1];
157                for (int label = minLabel; label <= maxLabel; label++) {
158                        regionArray[label] = new SegmentationBackedRegion(label, this);
159                }
160                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
161                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
162                                int label = getLabel(u, v);
163                                if (label >= minLabel && label <= maxLabel && regionArray[label] != null) {
164                                        regionArray[label].addPixel(u, v);
165                                }
166                        }
167                }
168                // create a list of regions to return, collect nonempty regions
169                Map<Integer, SegmentationBackedRegion> regionMap = new LinkedHashMap<>();
170                for (SegmentationBackedRegion r: regionArray) {
171                        if (r != null && r.getSize() > 0) {
172                                r.update();     // compute the statistics for this region
173                                regionMap.put(r.getLabel(), r); //add(r);
174                        }
175                }
176                return regionMap;
177        }
178        
179        /**
180         * Get the label number for the specified image coordinate.
181         * @param u the horizontal coordinate.
182         * @param v the vertical coordinate.
183         * @return the label number for the given position.
184         */
185        public int getLabel(int u, int v) {
186                return (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height) ? labelArray[u][v] : -1;
187        }
188        
189        protected void setLabel(int u, int v, int label) {
190                if (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height)
191                        labelArray[u][v] = label;
192        }
193        
194        protected int getNextLabel() {
195                currentLabel = (currentLabel < 1) ? minLabel : currentLabel + 1;
196                maxLabel = currentLabel;
197                return currentLabel;
198        }
199        
200        protected boolean isLabel(int i) {
201                return (i >= minLabel);
202        }
203
204        // --------------------------------------------------
205
206        /**
207         * Finds the region associated to the given label.
208         * @param label the region's label number.
209         * @return the region object associated with the given label
210         *              or {@code null} if it does not exist.
211         */
212        public SegmentationBackedRegion getRegion(int label) {
213                return (label < minLabel || label > maxLabel) ? null : regions.get(label);
214        }
215        
216        /**
217         * Finds the {@link BinaryRegion} instance associated with
218         * the given image position.
219         * @param u the horizontal position.
220         * @param v the vertical position.
221         * @return The associated {@link BinaryRegion} object or null if
222         *              this {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} has no region at the given position.
223         */
224        public SegmentationBackedRegion getRegion(int u, int v) {
225                return getRegion(getLabel(u, v));
226        }
227
228}
